line.commentary: This opening line introduces a profound concept using natural imagery. Consider what a valley (谷) represents - what are its characteristics? Empty yet containing, hollow yet powerful...
'玄牝' (dark-female) is one of the most mysterious terms in Daoism. 謂 is how we name or call something - what follows is a special term.
門 (gate/door) is a powerful metaphor in Chinese philosophy - think about what a door represents: passage, potential, transition between states...
Note how 根 (root) connects to the earlier valley imagery. In Classical Chinese, when you see '之' connecting terms, it often shows possession or relationship.
绵绵 is a reduplication (repeated character) suggesting continuity. 若 often introduces a simile - 'as if' or 'like.' What kind of existence is being described?
Notice how 用 (use/utilize) connects to the idea of practical application. 勤 suggests laborious effort - what might this say about how we should approach this mysterious force?
